gurmukhi: nwm crm ky piRQm kih Cydk bhur bKwn ] nwm sBY sRI bwn ky cqur ic`q mY jwnu ]81]
transliteration: Naam Charan Ke Pritham Kah(i) Chhedak Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Sabhai Sribaan Ke Chatur Chitt Mai Jaan(u)||81||
translation: After uttering the names of “Charam” and tehn adding the word “Chhedak”, the wise people come to know all the names of Baan in their mind.81.

gurmukhi: suBtM nwm aucwir kY hw pd bhur sunwid ] nwm islImuK ky sBY lIjhu cqur bnwie ]82]
transliteration: Soubhtan Naam Oucdaar(i) Kai Haa Pad Bahur Sounaae|| Naam Sileemoukh Ke Sabhai Leejoh Chatur Banaae||82||
translation: After uttering the name “Subhat” and then adding the word “Ha”, the wise people tell all the names of Baan.82.

gurmukhi: sB pMCn ky nwm kih pr pd bhur bKwn ] nwm islImuK ky sBY icq mY cqur pCwn ]83]
transliteration: Sabh Panchhan Ke Naam Kah(i) Par Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Sileemoukh Ke Sabhai Chit Mai Chatur Pachhaad||83||
translation: Uttering the names of all the birds and then adding the word “Par” with them, the wise people recognize the names of Baan.83.

gurmukhi: pMCI prI spMK Dr piC AMqk pun BwKu ] nwm islImuK kys BY jwn hiRdY my rwKu ]84]
transliteration: Panchhiparisapankh Dhar Pachh(i) Antak Poun Bhaakh(u)|| Naam Seeleemoukh Kes Bhai Jaan Hridai Mai Raakh(u)||84||
translation: After adding the word “Antak” with the words “Pakshi, Paresh and Pankhdhar” all the names of Baan are recognized in mind.84.

gurmukhi: sB AkwS ky nwm kih cr pd bhur bKwn ] nwm islImuK ky sBY lIjY cqur pCwn ]85]
transliteration: Sabh Akaadh Ke Naam Kah(i) Char Pad Bahur Bakhaan|| Naam Sileemoukh Ke Sabhai Laajai Chatur Pachhaad||85||
translation: Uttering all names of “Aakaash” and then saying the word “Char”, the wise people recognize all the names of Baan.85.

gurmukhi: Ky AkwS niB ggn kih cr pd bhur aucwr ] nwm skl sRI bwn ky lIjhu cqur suDwr ]86]
transliteration: Khe Akaadh Nabh(i) Gadan Kah(i) Char Pad Bahur Ouchaar|| Naam Sakal Srihaan Ke Leejoh Chatur Sudhaar||86||
translation: After saying the words “Khe, Aakaash, Nabh and Gagan” and then uttering the word “Char”, the wise people may comprehend correctly all the names of Baan.86.

gurmukhi: Awsmwn isipihr su idv grdUM bhur bKwnu ] puin cr Sbd bKwnIAY nwm bwn ky jwn ]87]
transliteration: Aasmaan Sipihir Su Div Gaddoon Bahur Bakhaan(u)|| Poun(i) Char Shabad Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Ke Jaan||87||
translation: After speaking the words “Aasmaan, Sipihir, div, Gardoon etc.” and then saying word “Char”, the names of Baan are known.87.

gurmukhi: piRQm nwm kih cMdR ky Dr pd bhuro dyhu ] puin cr Sbd aucwrIAY nwm bwn liK lyhu ]88]
transliteration: Pritham Naam Kah(i) Channdra Ke Dhar Pad Bahuro Deh(u)|| Poun(i) Char Shabad Oucdareeai Naam Baan Lakh(i) Leh(u)
translation: Uttering the name “Chandra” in the beginning and then adding the word “Deh” and afterwards speaking the word “Char”, the names of Baan are formed.88.

gurmukhi: go mrIic ikrnM Ctw Dr Drkih mn mwih ] cr pd bhur bKwnIAY nwm bwn huie jwih ]89]
transliteration: Go Dareech(i) Kirnan Chhataa Dhar Dharkah(i) Man Maah(i)|| Char Pad Bahur Bakhaaneeai Naam Baan Hue Jaah(i)||89||
translation: After adding the word “Char” at the end of the words “Go, Marich, Kiran, Chhataadhar etc.”, the names of Baan are formed.89.

gurmukhi: rjnISr idnhw aucir Dr Dr pd kih AMq ] nwm skl sRI bwn ky inkrq jwih AnMq ]90]
transliteration: Rajneeshar Dinhaa Ouchar(i) Dhar Dhar Pad Kah(i) Ant|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Nikrat Jaah(i) Anant||90||
translation: After uttering the words “Rajnishwar and Dinha” and adding the word “Dhurandhar” at the end, the names of Baan are evolved.90.

gurmukhi: rwqR insw idn GwqnI crDr Sbd bKwn ] nwm skl sRI bwn ky krIAhu cqur biKAwn ]91]
transliteration: Raatra Nisaa Din Ghaatanichardhar Shabad Bakhaan|| Naam Sakal Sribaan Ke Dareeauh Chatur Bakhiaan||91||
translation: Saying the word “Chardhar” alongwith the words “Ratri, Nisha and Din-ghatini”, all the names of Baan are evolved.91.

gurmukhi: sis auprwjn riv hrn cr ko lY kY nwm ] Dr kih nwm ey bwn ky jpy AwThUM jwm ]92]
transliteration: Sas(i) Oupraajan Rav(i) Haran Char Ko Lai Kai Naam|| Dhar Kah(i) Naam E Baan Ke Jape Aath-hoon Jaam||92||
translation: After uttering the name “Raatri”, then speaking “Char” and afterwards saying the word “Dhar”, all the names of Baan can be remembered.92.

gurmukhi: rYin AMDpiq mhwN inis inis eISr inis rwj ] cMdRbwn cMdiH DrXo icqRn ky bD kwj ]93]
transliteration: Rain(i) Andhpat(i) Mahaan Nis(i) Nis(i) Eeshar Nis(i) Raaj|| Channdrabaan Channdrah(i) Ddaryo Chitran Ke Badh Kaaj||93||
translation: The words “raatri, Andhakaarpati, Nispati” etc. are known by the name Chandra-Baan, which in the form of “Chandrama” (moon), kill the forms steeped in darkness.93.

gurmukhi: sB ikrnn ky nwm kih Dr pd bhur aucwr ] puin Dr khu sB bwn ky jwnu nwm inrDwr ]94]
transliteration: Sabh Kirnan Ke Naam Kah(i) Dhar Pad Bahur Ouchaar|| Poun(i) Dhar Kaho Sabh Baan Ke Jaan(u) Naam Nirdhaar||94||
translation: Saying the names of all the rays, then uttering the word “Dhar” and afterwards repeating the word “Dhar” again, all the names of Baan are known.94.
